nodes.bodyText:
Based on JetBrains/kotlin#2057 (comment) we should probably avoid using this one, and rely directly on JSR223 dependencies.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                implementation("org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-stdlib-jdk8")
          
          
            
                implementation("org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-compiler-embeddable")
          
          
            
                implementation("org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-scripting-compiler-embeddable")
          
          
            
                implementation("org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-script-util")
          
          
            
                val ktVersion = "1.3.72"
          
          
            
                api("org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-stdlib-jdk8:$ktVersion")
          
          
            
                implementation("org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-scripting-jsr223-embeddable:$ktVersion")
          
          
            
                implementation("org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-compiler-embeddable:$ktVersion")
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@
+import org.zaproxy.gradle.addon.AddOnStatus
+
+plugins {
+    kotlin("jvm") version "1.3.50"
+}
+
+version = "1.0.0"
+description = "Allows Kotlin to be used for ZAP scripting - (some) templates included"
+
+zapAddOn {
+    addOnName.set("Kotlin Support")
+    addOnStatus.set(AddOnStatus.ALPHA)
+    zapVersion.set("2.9.0")
+
+    manifest {
+        author.set("StackHawk Engineering")
+    }
+}
+
+dependencies {
+    implementation("org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-stdlib-jdk8")
+    implementation("org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-compiler-embeddable")
+    implementation("org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-scripting-compiler-embeddable")
+    implementation("org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-script-util")

nodes.bodyText: The engines should use the existing class loaders otherwise this might (and will) lead to duplicated classes (causing subtle/surprising errors), the above suggestions should address this.

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            kotlin.options.title=Kotlin
          
          
            
            kotlin.name=Kotlin

nodes.bodyText:
engineClassLoader → fallbackClassLoader, should replace ExtensionFactory.getAddOnLoader() (which can be passed in the default constructor).
Should be package accessible, just for testing?
Does it really need to be OS dependent? (It can be added to the string, instead of called each time.)
These tests should be moved to another test class (e.g. KotlinEngineWrapperUnitTest), they are not verifying the templates.
Worth testing print too.
e.g. shouldLoadClassesFromProvidedClassLoader, not about the hash code(?).

It needs to use other class than the ones available in the context class loader (technically it can be the same class file but loaded from other class loader), otherwise we don't know if it was from the provided class loader or the context class loader (the class loaders need to be different).
Better return (or pass through the bindings) the Class and check by reference, to not rely on the hash code which can be changed any time.
This should be kept as EngineClassLoader, can be final too.
